articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: 'It's practically a war zone': Unprecedented threat to life continues as Australia fires rage on
articles.description: More than 10 million acres have been ravaged by deadly wildfires, destroying more than 1,000 homes. At least 17 people have died since the fires began, and millions of animals are presumed dead by ecologists. Conditions are anticipated to worsen in the coming…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Katy Tur breaks down the latest developments in the impeachment inquiry
articles.description: On day 101 of the impeachment inquiry, Katy Tur rounds up the latest developments. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi is still holding the articles of impeachment until a deal is reached for a fair Senate trial. Congress returns next week and impeachment will dominat…

articles.title: Booker: Voters are frustrated that the DNC is restricting the debates
articles.description: Senator Cory Booker joined Andrea Mitchell to discuss the state of his campaign and the 2020 race, as Julian Castro drops out of the race, leaving the Democratic field increasingly less diverse.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Esper: Embassy attack is part of 40 years of maligned behavior from Iran
articles.description: Defense Secretary Mark Esper joins Andrea Mitchell to discuss the latest developments on the ground following the attack on the American embassy in Baghdad. He warned that the U.S. could "take preemptive action" if Iran prepares additional attacks, and tells …

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: The nagging detail undermining Trump's stock market boasts
articles.description: Trump believes stock market growth since he took office is "far outpacing" his presidential predecessors. That's plainly false.
articles.content:
In early November, Donald Trump published an exceedingly Trumpian tweet, declaring, Stock Markets (all three) hit another ALL TIME & HISTORIC HIGH yesterday! You are sooo lucky to have me as your President (just kidding!).
A month later, a reporter told … [+2677 chars]
